main event: An ANG pilot flying at 40,000 ft near Joliet, Illinois, saw a large, flat, silver-colored object approaching at high speed, performing acute maneuvers for about 10 minutes before gradually fading out of view.
interesting points: The object was described as yellowish in color, round, and fuzzy in outline, with intermittent light emissions.
The pilot reported the object to be the size of his finger when he placed it on the aircraft's windshield, indicating it was relatively large and close.
The object was observed for 30 minutes, making it a prolonged and detailed sighting.
The pilot attempted to contact Chicago ARTC and ADDC via radio to report the sighting.
Investigations by various military and civilian authorities found no evidence of unusual activities or aircraft in the area at the time.
sighted object: Large, flat, silver-colored object with intermittent light emissions
